page.title: 05Weston Underwood
page.content: The largest village in our area is Weston Underwood. It consists of 2 farms, with old farmhouses, 31 houses (28 modern and 3 old), 14 new bungalows and 1 old one, and 13 cottages, one of which is the Post Office. Most of the new houses, which were built in the 1970's, were built in what was then farmland. In several gardens we can see signs of ridge and furrow ploughing, which was used in Victorian times to make extra area. The only shop in the village is the Post Office, which is in an extension to a cottage, dated 1860. The extension was originally built for use as a garage, but is now used as a shop. Mrs Sue Gratian deals with 30+ pensions and about 30 family allowances for local people, and takes care of all the usual P.O. facilities. In addition, she sells greetings
